item.title: The US is in recession — 93 replies — 372.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
The US is in recession

Open thread • Replies: 93 • Updated: 2026-02-17 17:37 UTC

OP

The US is in recession

Early replies (first 3)

61857499
White collar recession comes before regular recession 100% of the time. We've been in a white collar recession since 2020.

61857500
>>61857490
Always was, its depression for over a year now.

61857508
>>61857490
GDP is growing, recession is fake.

Nothing ever happens.

Stop putting your vibes and feelings into your job search, learn to get better skills and be more marketable to employers.

McDonalds is always hiring

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61861531
>>61861445
>”we are almost entirely self-sufficient”
>”ok we currently have no infrastructure to mine these resources”
Yes, exactly. We are totally dependent on foreign suppliers and as of right now we do not have a domestic source for these things. My point stands and yours is wrong. Coping about how we COULD have these things eventually doesn’t matter. Like it or not, the US is not self-sufficient, and it isn’t close. We import tremendous amounts of goods. Don’t even bother looking into pharmaceuticals because it will just depress you.

61861694
>>61857750
We've been in a recession since 2023. This isn't glorphf's fault or joepedo. Our economy is fake and gay made up of jewish daycare bullshit jobs. Soon it will all unravel.

61861711
>>61861531
Don't get your panties in a bunch, all I took issue with was saying "virtually no domestic source." Some people in these discussions act like SEA is the only place in the world that has minerals.

A water source is still there even if nobody builds a well. Since you seem to get that, you were probably looking for the phrase "domestic SUPPLY."

61861724
>>61857805

Oh no, its over, the Europeans and Anglos are mad we voted a republican again.

61861729
>>61858084
The fantasy is better than the reality

61861769
>>61857805
We should be bombing Mexico.

61861811
>>61861711
No I wasn’t. I don’t feel like explaining it to you so I’ll just let AI do it.

61863135
>>61858023
Pam Bondi was such a hot piece of ass when she was young. She's still sorta cute give that she's sixty years old. It's too bad she's protecting Jewish pedophiles and cannibals.

61863175
>>61857490
BUMP

61863206
And the burger gov is again burning absolutely everything in the market, including themselves to make a smoke screen to cover the crashing dollar.
Nobody wants that shit yet it is going up with not only no buyers but countries constantly throwing it into the market. Absolute shitshow from a drowning in shit man.
Funny isn't it?

61863218
>>61860719
The boat that is jewsa has been sinking for a while. The orange nigger is actively making more holes in it and setting it on fire

61863252
What's the polymarket for that??

61863679
>>61857500
Try since 08. Things have never actually genuinely recovered.

61864332
>>61857490
End of the Juglar cycle. Overproduction crisis. Fed interest rates plunging toward zero. Soon an other Capital idling necessary.

61864333
>>61863679
Capital final crisis since 2008.

61864989
>>61863206
2006 was giving out loans like candy to people who had absolutely no way of ever servicing them
this then resulted in a lot of forced selling into a no bid market as all of this inventory was cleared when the bubble popped

right now we dont have excessive loans, quite the opposite retards arent given insane loans this is legit existing money bidding up hard assets because so much money got printed and it has to go somewhere
you dont get a crash in housing without forced selling and who is going to force sell his real estate at low prices without the bank margin calling them
unlike stocks which are completely fungible and its price is set at the margin, housing isnt and the owner can just sit on the asset forever and not be forced to take any offer being made at market price

to disrupt this 'bubble' you need the government unprinting the money supply (lol, lmao even) or you need a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep and force dump it
the second one is the only realistic option, tho there is also the risk that the heirs can pay for the inheritance and real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands and the nation reduced to permarenting slave

61865001
It really isn't mentioned enough that our "recovery" after 2008 was just setting interest rates to 0 for 10 years.

61865048
>>61864989
>...a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep...real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands....
You've laid out exactly what's been going on since 2008

61865068
>>61865048
yes thats the point, the implication here is that real estate is now permanently priced out of the middle class income range
not that a crash is imminent like the anon i was replying to seemed to suggest

61865501
>>61857490
I knew it was really over when Wendy's and pizza Hut announced theyre closing hundreds of stores.

61865585
>>61857490
Idk these terms, and economics is a fraudulent science anyways, so I'll just say what I see.

My life sucks.
Its getting worse.
I am watching generational decline among my family (each new set of kids struggle more than their parents).
People seem unhappy.

Call that recession, depression, or economic boon! Idc, US is a shithole.


I'm sure people will respond saying I'm cherry picking. Dishonesty is rampant.

61865659
>>61857779
>Foreign money taking investments out of the US because trump is an unpredictable fucking moron being puppeteered by unironically evil people
>American dollar has lost 10% of its value over the course of 2025
>Constant tariff bullshitery that is objectively hurting American industries that rely on imports
>Nuked basedbean deal with China on top of farmers needing a fucking bailout because of the retard they voted in (again)
>Tourism industry cratering every day as we speak so even less money being injected into the economy
>ICE operation have caused businesses across the country to shut down because either no one's willing to go out, or because they don't want random goons in masks harassing employees
Dude it's actually impressive how hard these retards just destroyed the entire reputation of america abroad and fucked us over domestically, but his cult fan base and circle of wannabe oligarchs who own media outlets will continue telling you that there is no war in ba sing se

61865663
>>61861063
We really need to do what the Chinese do with making sure household consumption as share of GDP is increasing. Actually reflects living standards instead of billions of dollars getting spitswapped between 3-4 different AI companies constantly. Then again, most of the people hear would just ree hearing the term “5 year plan” or “stability focused infrastructure development.”

61865674
>>61865585
MIGAtrannies will happily eat shit if a libtard has to smell their breath.

61865800
>>61865585
>US is a shithole
and the usa still gives you about the best chance in the world to improve your life if you come from humble beginnings
altho it also offers you every temptation possible to make you drive yourself over the financial cliff at every turn at the same time it offers you opportunity
just know its far worse everywhere else as society in general is reverting back to medieval style caste based system of neither hope nor escape

61865942
>>61865800
>and the usa still gives you about the best chance in the world to improve your life if you come from humble beginnings
this has not been true in at least 20-25 years

61866035
>>61865942
lol, lmao
then give me the list of countries that you think arent just better today but were better 20 years ago and i'll have a good laugh

and to clarify we are specifically talking about giving chances to poor unconnected people so dont say retarded shit like liechtenstein

61866071
>>61865800
>he fell for the meme

61866130
>>61860705
None of these are necessary. We could be totally self-sufficient, even for things like rare-earths. The Epstein class decided that would be bad for them so we aren't.

61866186
>>61866130
>pharmaceuticals are not necessary
>input goods for new tech are not necessary
Uh huh. So what’s necessary? Shovels, canned food and farmland? If you want to be Amish so badly just do it, nobody is stopping you.

In the real world, though, self-sufficiency would entail access to pharmaceuticals and the ability to evolve technologically and keep up with the first world. We can sing songs all day about how the US could be self-sufficient one day and that’s fine. The point is that we aren’t.

Privacy Coins

Open thread • Replies: 71 • Updated: 2026-02-17 17:33 UTC

Whether you like it or not, BTC is dying. Which way anons?

61849481
Gold and silver.

61849898

>>61849481

61849958
>>61849447
>BTC is a pedo coin
>most used currency for CP is not however
quit the infighting, monegro.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61862538
>steals pic that is interesting from nervjeet
>stolen image literally has the fucking fileneame from the post it came from
>this bot thinks im the same guy
>his nonsensical bot reply gives him away within a few posts because it always handles the same
Report this fucker, if he doesnt get banned, all the more reason to NOT trust monero or anyone pushing monero, because the bot is being run from 4chan itself.

on the XMR thread, this is the same bot>>61860201 DXIC7i+b
it just goes on and on. hope real anons find this post and start to question wtf is going on around here.

61862542
>>61862475
Do you have Revolut?

Use it on Hodlhodl (trade escrow service)
Send it to some BTC wallet (Sparrow)
Use Trocador to convert it to XMR

61862551
>>61859002
Privacy is basically impossible to do for smart contracts outside of creating a specific app such as Tornado. When you create specific apps such as Tornado, you make it extremely vulnerable to censorship from the government, like happened to Tornado. Even though the lawsuit was "dropped", activity on Tornado is basically nonexistent because nobody trusts it anymore. They shouldn't. Likewise, nobody should ever trust a "privacy app" on top of a public L1.

And don't get me started on how ridiculous a "privacy L2" would be on top of a public L1.

If you want privacy, you start at the L1 layer.
If you want privacy, you choose Monero.

61862566
>>61862538
>>this bot thinks im the same guy
No, I think you're a nerva shill that tries to play stupid and make this about BTC (it never was) and me being bad because I expose your stupidity.
>>his nonsensical bot reply gives him away within a few posts because it always handles the same
If it took you 7 posts to undercover my identity as the jeet enemy #1 then either I'm not as predictable as you say or you're retarded.

Because I always refute every point nervajeets make.
>hope real anons find this post and start to question wtf is going on around here.
I'm real, that's why I continuously offer you to ask me anything regarding XMR. All of the questions you (in English this can be used both for singular and plural, raj) posted have been answered. I'm glad you visited the general again and saw that they actually have been answered three years ago already on your favorite platform - reddit.
If you have any flaws in XMR's you wish to point out let me know, otherwise admit defeat or continue embarrassing yourself publicly.

61862608

NO ONE MADE ANY POINTS ITT you fucking poo stain bot.

item.title: >mom yells at me for not having a job 5 months after I got laid off from my last one >Complains how we need more money t… — 40 replies — 42.5/hr
item.content:encoded:
>mom yells at me for not having a job 5 months after I got laid off from my last one >Complains how we need more money t…

Open thread • Replies: 40 • Updated: 2026-02-17 16:41 UTC

OP

>mom yells at me for not having a job 5 months after I got laid off from my last one
>Complains how we need more money to pay the bills and how she can't keep working 10 hour shifts to pay our bills
>Look through her purse when she's not looking
>See a $600 receipt for perfume and makeup, and a bank note evidencing a $1800 transfer to her neet sister who also has 2 neet sons and a neet daughter.
>Dad gambled away another $10K in stocks.
>He keeps sending me job openings in other states/cities that require 10+ years of experience and he tells me "just walk up to them and ask them to train you, that's how we did it back in the old days"
>My own savings are slowly dwindling and I've got no more than a few months left before I'm officially broke
>800+ job apps and nothing yet
I'm not sure how much more of this I can take bros...
Why won't the economy get better?
Who do I blame for this miserable situation?
What are some easy painless ways to check out of this economy earlier don't speak?
Why are old people all so stupid and contemptible?
NGMI?

>>61863594

61863605

>a bank note evidencing a $1800 transfer to
>Dad gambled away another $10K in stocks

It really isn't. You can live VERY cheaply in a lot of Asian countries (Thailand, Laos, Indonesia) and do ridiculously low-paying remote work and still come out with net savings every month.

I worked in Taiwan (DON'T GO THERE) for a while and was able to save over 50% of my pay even though I made half as much as an American would make doing the same job (not ESLosering).

Wish I hadn't because it completely destroyed my health permanently (they're just as bad, maybe worse, about dumping toxic industrial chemicals in food as the mainland chinsects), but it was the only thing available to me after the 2008-12 crash during the Obamaconomy.

item.title: Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us? — 25 replies — 16.6/hr
item.content:encoded:
Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us?

Open thread • Replies: 25 • Updated: 2026-02-17 16:07 UTC

OP

You guys in the EU make less than us on paychecks, but you get to keep more of your money because you have universal healthcare and PTO while we have to pay for private insurance which chronically denies people's health situations.

Are people saying that starting a business in the EU is difficult because of the regulations? What regulations does the European union impose on its citizen's than they think it's easier to start in the United States instead?

Early replies (first 3)

61860815
>>61860796
Depends enormously on which country are we talking about. Some are easy (Germany) some are very hard (Italy)

61860817
>>61860796
> you get to keep more of your money because you have universal healthcare
yeah right
good luck getting that "universal healthcare" if you're not a boomer, waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure. It's either you go private (and pay out of your own pocket) or you die
> and PTO
oh wow, 20 wagie cagie free days a year. Totally worth the 60%+ taxes.

All taxation is theft. It's just that. Taxation doesn't pay for services. It's just the way they control the economy, and here in EU they fucking LOVE to control what you can and cannot do. They print the money, they don't need to tax you. They tax you to control you (and to humiliate you)

61860822
>>61860796
The healthcare thing is too much american leftie argument, it also has been very overcrowded by you guessed arabs and africans, unironically I was better treated when I broke my leg in brazil of all places then in france

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61860823
>>61860815
How about the Czech Republic?

61860836
>>61860817
>waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure
we have them too except they're called "pre authorization" and we still get to pay for it all.

61860837
>>61860796
>What regulations does the European union impose on its citizen's than they think it's easier to start in the United States instead?
You're shitting me right? As the other guy said it really varies based on the country, but in places like Italy you need 20 authorizations and 10 certifications (that you pay for) to open something like a bar or a carpentry shop, plus constant "controls" which are basically bribe requests at this point by officials of all kinds. Oh, and good luck filing your taxes. Here's how it goes
> be business owner
> tax filing time (yay)
> tax system is so incredibly fucking complex you have to hire people just to calculate how much you own
> because of course YOU need to tell the state how much the state wants from YOU
> slightest fuck up? You're on the hook for 240% of the original amount
> they have 5-7 years to come after you
> "oh hello here's a tax bill from 5 years ago cause you filed 3.51 euros less than you were supposed to, plus 1500 eur sanction, plus interest"
> oh btw you pay FIRST, and MAYBE when (after an average of 12 years in court at your expense) you are declared right, you get it back, no interest accrued, your legal expenses still on your back
> so most people just pay
> it's mafia with a hand of paint on top and the full force of the state behind it
EU is completely fucked. Stay away. We can just pray it somehow implodes from within. These bureaucrat jew lover good goyim will kill us all and replace us with shitskin and pajeets and they will feast on top of it all while the continent dies

61860842
>>61860837
>tax system is so incredibly fucking complex you have to hire people just to calculate how much you own
>> because of course YOU need to tell the state how much the state wants from YOU
>> slightest fuck up? You're on the hook for 240% of the original amount
>> they have 5-7 years to come after you
>> "oh hello here's a tax bill from 5 years ago cause you filed 3.51 euros less than you were supposed to, plus 1500 eur sanction, plus interest"
>> oh btw you pay FIRST, and MAYBE when (after an average of 12 years in court at your expense) you are declared right, you get it back, no interest accrued, your legal expenses still on your back
>> so most people just pay
>> it's mafia with a hand of paint on top and the full force of the state behind it
>EU is completely fucked. Stay away.
again this is more or less the same as the US

61860847
>>61860823
A bureaucracy nightmare.

61860850
>>61860842
everywhere is completely fucked, but you burgers have weapons and a strong constitution that backs you

yeah you're retarded pussies and you will never ever use them, we all know. I mean they're telling you know that you're ruled upon by a bunch of satanist jew pedophiles and there's no shooting in the streets, so there you have it. But at least you have the guns. If the Cheka comes knocking at your door demanding your harvest and your daughters, you can shoot back at the fuckers. Here in EU we're basically at the mercy of a state that hates us and wants us dead, and we have only our dicks to hold in our hands to defend ourselves from it

61860860
>>61860796
As far as I keep reading on economic subreddits, negligible, the US just has far more available credit and tax companies a bit less at start allowing them to grow, otherwise its basically the same, sounds legit just a complacency issue from europeans, most of the time they get more unemployment benefits than they would working and have legit no time limit for them so they just don't bother lol

61860967
in my country, the one thing one has to look out for is paying for your own social/healthinsurance, ie, if you have your own business, you need to pay taxes for your own health/socialinsurance, and the taxman wont ask you for the first 3y of that business.
After the 3y pass, you will then have to payup all the retrospective social insurance tax costs incurred, which fucks over a lot of retard or unfortunate first business owners

61861032
>>61860837
This is why we need a unified EU business regulation and undermind the corrupt sovereignist that want to keep individual burocratic fuckery.

61861057
>>61860815
>Some are easy (Germany)
> some are very hard (Italy)
let me guess italian never tried germany?
Germany is known to be a bureucracy hellhole with people fleeing to other countries from it.

>>61861032
>unified will fix it
France&germany have been dictating eu lawmaking. You will eat shit as you already do. You have eu wide higher taxes because germany didnt want to compete and made mandatory higher minimum vat a thing.

Not to mention that countries that joined got their industries destroyed by unified regulation and had to import from germany/france what they used to produce themself

61861071
It's the one thing the USA gets right. I personally made a "business" (that never made any profit) in the span of an afternoon. Cost maybe $200 to get my identification numbers for the llc

61861091
>>61861032
yeah let's give the EU bureaucrats more power that will fix it

61861111
>>61860796
>Is it really that much more difficult to start a business in the eu than us?
Depends on the business. If you want to do something shady the US is the place to go. The US has barely any standards and barely any regulations.

61861113
>>61860817
>waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure
What are you talking about? I live currently in the EU and have never had to wait for medical care.

61861119
Us is easier.
I have created 2 corpos and 1 llc for different purposes within the past 8 years. You can do it all online for a few bucks, other regulations depend on specific industry but overall it's pretty easy

61861128
>>61860860
higher taxation alone puts euros at a disadvantage. Its fine if you do a local job since you compete with locals but anything online / shipped its bad since they have to be more efficient than rest of world to reach same profit margin.

As for amount of bureaucracy its fucking complex and depends on what country and what profession. There is even stupid shit like if you run a repair shop and repair inside your building it counts different than if you decide to drive to your customer and repair locally. In the later case they classify you as a handyman worker and will fine you if you didn't register with the craftsman ministry. Also if you do something you didn't register for you will also be fined but you can register as " i will do anything" more broadly and dodge it. The amount of bullshit can easily fill a book.

61861429
>>61860796
Depends on what your goals are, the type of business, your personal goals and the markets you wish to enter. In general it's more of an investment in the long run but if you plan to offer your services or products in the EU anyway it makes sense to start your business here and already be compliant

61861441
>>61860817
>waiting lists are years for even a basic exam/procedure.
Yeah, I remember waiting decades for my appendicitis, it rupturing and me dying because of it. Thankfully they could keep me alive for months despite the extreme difficulties this poses.

>>61861032
We need more unified European regulation. Sadly the EU is not an economic alliance anymore.

61862545
>>61860796
>>61860860
I love how hard it is to even talk about european economy on reddit, not because of europeans, but because of american lefties, if you so much, and most times you don't even need to, mention the US, they will flock like a horde to claim the US lies about everything, that 30% of americans are unemployed and nearly no one in europe, the EU is literal worker's paradise and how much they love their welfare policies and hate the US greed, its quite hilarious really how much they want a nanny state.

61865504
It is, soon it will was once EU Inc comes into play

61865623
>>61860796
>you have universal healthcare
yea but you have to wait 1 year+ because there is a million niggers in queue before you

61865645
>>61861057
Lol this is true.
Germany and France made the EU suck with their shit like GDPR etc. Spain happily sniffs every turd. The rest aren't better.
